meanings.definition: In a way that shows or is affected by nervousness.
meanings.sent1: She looked nervously at the test paper, unsure of the answers.
meanings.sent2: He tapped his foot nervously while waiting for the interview to start.
meanings.sent3: The cat eyed the vacuum cleaner nervously, suspecting it was a new enemy.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds gathered nervously in the sky, hinting at an impending storm.
meanings.sent5: The child clutched his teddy bear nervously during the thunderstorm.

meanings.definition: In a way that is characterized by or causing nervousness.
meanings.sent1: The teacher spoke nervously in front of the class, stumbling over words.
meanings.sent2: The dog barked nervously at the unfamiliar sound outside.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel nervously hoarded acorns, fearing a shortage in winter.
meanings.sent4: The old house creaked nervously in the strong wind, as if afraid of falling.
meanings.sent5: The actor paced nervously backstage, waiting for the cue to go on.
